structMember.name: timeStamp
structMember.description: Indicates when the test was executed.

structMember.name: hwTestStatus
structMember.description: Indicates the status of the last hardware test.

structMember.name: altitude
structMember.description:
Defines the altitude part of the position of the unit in meters. Use +/- values to denote height or depth.
Unit: 0.1 meter

structMember.name: geoDatum
structMember.description:
Denotes the geodetic datum for this position.
Example: WGS84 (World Geodetic System 1984)

structMember.name: latitude
structMember.description:
Defines the latitude part of the position of the unit. Use +/- values to denote north or south.
Unit: 0.000001 degrees

structMember.name: longitude
structMember.description: Defines the longitude part of the position of the unit. Use +/- values to denote east or west.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description: The date the product was produced.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number of the product.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The revision state of the product.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: Unique number identifying the product instance.

structMember.name: indicatorStatus
structMember.description: The current status of the special Indicator.

structMember.name: indicatorName
structMember.description: The name of the special indicator.

enumMember.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumMember.description: The indicator is not supported.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: The indicator state is currently not available.

enumMember.name: OFF
enumMember.description: The indicator is off.

enumMember.name: STEADY_ON
enumMember.description: The indicator is on continuously.

enumMember.name: SLOW_BLINK
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks slowly.

enumMember.name: FAST_BLINK
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks quickly.

enumMember.name: DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_STEADY_ON
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks twice and is then on for a short time. This cycle is then repeated.

enumMember.name: DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF
enumMember.description: The indicator blinks twice and is then off for a short time. This cycle is then repeated.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down, normal users are prevented from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: Indicates a log full condition. The semantics are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

enumMember.name: RESTART_WARM
enumMember.description: Restarts the MO with the same software. The software is not reloaded from the disk. The traffic is affected least as warm restart is faster and no hardware is reset.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLD
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets all hardware. The traffic is affected more than for a warm restart.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLDWTEST
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets and tests the hardware. The traffic is affected most.

enumMember.name: NO_TEST_RESULT
enumMember.description: No result is availabe.

enumMember.name: TEST_RESULT_OK
enumMember.description: Result is OK.

enumMember.name: TEST_RESULT_CEF
enumMember.description: Complete entity failure.

enumMember.name: TEST_RESULT_PEF
enumMember.description: Partial entitiy failure.

enumMember.name: PLANNED_RECONFIGURATION
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform planned activities such as reconfigurations.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_EXTERNAL_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve node external problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_UPGRADE_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve upgrade problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_O_AND_M_ISSUE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve O&M issues.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_CYCLIC_RECOVERY
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to stop further auto recovery attempts.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_COLD_WITH_HW_TEST
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform HW tests.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_LOW_COVERAGE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to improve Cell Availability.

enumMember.name: OPERATOR_CLASSIFIED_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve procedural errors or office environmental problems. Example: power, grounding, temperature, humidity or security problems.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

rule.exceptionText: Must be of the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] where T separates the time and the date parts and Z indicates the time zone in relation to UTC. Example 2000-08-01T17:17:34.1+01:00.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

class.name: FieldReplaceableUnit
class.description: This MO models a Field Replaceable Unit (FRU).

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added.

action.name: writeRepairDelivNote
action.description: Writes HW log entry. Only one HW log entry is allowed for each unit. The existing entries in the HW log are not updated.

parameter.name: preparedBy
parameter.description: Name of operator preparing the log entry.

parameter.name: stateCode
parameter.description: The HW status when the failure occured: R = Repaired unit failed during installation or test. S = Unit in service failure occured. T = New unit failed during installation or test.

parameter.name: trNumber
parameter.description: If the unit has a connection with a trouble report, a reference to this must be supplied.

parameter.name: descriptionOfFault
parameter.description: Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described as well. For product safety reasons also specify fore, water damage and so on.

action.name: resetUnitInstallation
action.description: Uninstalls the corresponding FieldReplaceableUnit. Applicable only to FieldReplaceableUnits of type Radio Dot, and only when the unit has been physically removed. The action sets the availability status of the MO to NOT_INSTALLED.

attribute.name: fieldReplaceableUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: climateZoneRef
attribute.description: Specifies in which climate controlled zone this FRU is. Either referring to a Cabinet MO (when in a cabinet), or being empty (for instance in the case of an External Radio).
attribute.statusInformation: Since 16A, replaced by positionRef. Has no functional behavior.

attribute.name: operationalIndicator
attribute.description:
The operational status of the FRU as shown by the optical operational indicator on the unit.
Possible values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No power. • STEADY_ON = Operational, the unit can perform its intended purpose. • SLOW_BLINK = Dependent resource missing, the unit is non-operational. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_STEADY_ON = Loading software, the unit is operational during software loading. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF = Loading software, the unit is non-operational during software loading.

attribute.name: statusIndicator
attribute.description:
The status of the managed element as shown by the optical status indicator on the unit.
Possible values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No faults exist in the managed element. • STEADY_ON = A fault exists in the managed element.

attribute.name: faultIndicator
attribute.description:
The fault status of the FRU as shown by the optical fault indicator on the unit.
Possible values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No hardware fault. • STEADY_ON = Hardware fault.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description:
The maintenance status of the FRU as shown by the optical maintenance indicator on the unit.
Possible values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = Non-maintenance mode (unit unlocked). • STEADY_ON = Full maintenance mode (unit locked). • SLOW_BLINK = Removing ongoing traffic in the unit. • FAST_BLINK = Alarms suppressed in the managed element.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description: The product data of the installed Unit. If the corresponding hardware unit is not installed yet, the struct contains empty strings.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: hwTestResult
attribute.description: The test result from the latest restart of the FRU (with rank RESTART_COLDWTEST).

attribute.name: specialIndicator
attribute.description:
The current status of special indicators on the unit. The possible status values and semantics of these vary depending on the name of the indicator.
Possible values: Support Unit Fault Indicator • OFF = No associated support unit is faulty or inaccessible. • STEADY_ON = One or more associated support units are faulty or inaccessible.
Battery Fault Indicator • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently unavailable. • OFF = The battery is connected and no fault exists in the unit. • STEADY_ON = The battery is potentially faulty and must be examined. • SLOW_BLINK = The battery is manually disconnected or the circuit breaker has tripped and the battery is disconnected from the system voltage.
Power Distribution Fault Indicator • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No power distribution fault. • STEADY_ON = The PDU has lost contact with at least one ECM in the same sub-rack • SLOW_BLINK = Power distribution fault.

attribute.name: positionRef
attribute.description: Specifies position of the FRU. Refers to a Cabinet MO, a Shelf MO, a HwGroup MO, or it is empty, for example in an External Radio.

attribute.name: positionInformation
attribute.description:
The position of a FieldReplaceableUnit. It can be:
- On a shelf - Not on a shelf but inside or outside the cabinet - Be part of a HW group - At a remote site
If the hardware is contained on a shelf, the attribute position is used. Otherwise this attribute can be used, for example, to provide the address of a remote site, or to indicate that the unit is installed in connection to a specific shelf.

attribute.name: supportUnitRef
attribute.description: Reference to support units connected to this FieldReplaceableUnit.

attribute.name: positionCoordinates
attribute.description: The position of the FieldReplaceableUnit expressed as coordinates.

attribute.name: isSharedWithExternalMe
attribute.description: Indicates if the unit represented by this MO is managed also by another ManagedElement, to which it is physically connected. The attribute needs to be set correctly to ensure proper Operation & Maintenance of the shared unit. It should be noted that the attribute has no relation to the number of radio standards handled by the unit.
